vaccines.name: Hepatitis B (HepB)
vaccines.composition: Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) adsorbed onto aluminum hydroxide.
vaccines.additional_information: HepB vaccination is recommended for all infants to prevent chronic HBV infection. It is highly effective and part of routine childhood immunization schedules.

vaccines.name: DTaP (Diphtheria, Tetanus, and acellular Pertussis)
vaccines.composition: Diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine adsorbed onto aluminum phosphate.
vaccines.additional_information: DTaP vaccination is crucial for protection against these serious bacterial infections. Boosters are recommended every 10 years to maintain immunity.

vaccines.name: IPV (Inactivated Poliovirus)
vaccines.additional_information: IPV is highly effective in preventing poliovirus infections and is administered as an injection. It's an essential part of global efforts to eradicate polio.

vaccines.name: Hib (Haemophilus influenzae type b)
vaccines.composition: Hib capsular polysaccharide conjugated to a carrier protein.
vaccines.additional_information: Hib vaccination has dramatically reduced the incidence of Hib-related diseases since its introduction. It's safe and recommended as part of routine childhood immunizations.

vaccines.name: PCV13 (Pneumococcal Conjugate)
vaccines.composition: Polysaccharide capsular antigens of Streptococcus pneumoniae conjugated to a carrier protein.
vaccines.additional_information: PCV13 protects against 13 strains of S. pneumoniae and is highly effective in reducing severe pneumococcal infections in children.

vaccines.name: RV (Rotavirus)
vaccines.additional_information: RV vaccine is given orally and is highly effective in preventing severe diarrhea and dehydration caused by rotavirus infections.

vaccines.name: Influenza (Flu)
vaccines.composition: Inactivated or live attenuated influenza virus.
vaccines.additional_information: Influenza vaccination is recommended annually, especially for high-risk groups, to protect against circulating flu viruses.

vaccines.name: Varicella (Chickenpox)
vaccines.additional_information: Varicella vaccine is highly effective in preventing chickenpox and its complications, including severe skin infections.

vaccines.name: Tdap (Tetanus, Diphtheria, and acellular Pertussis)
vaccines.composition: Tetanus toxoid, diphtheria toxoid, and acellular pertussis vaccine adsorbed onto aluminum phosphate.
vaccines.indication: Booster for tetanus, diphtheria, and pertussis immunity.
vaccines.additional_information: Tdap boosters are recommended every 10 years to maintain protection against these bacterial infections.

vaccines.name: HPV (Human Papillomavirus)
vaccines.composition: Virus-like particles (VLPs) composed of L1 capsid proteins from HPV types 6, 11, 16, and 18.
schedule: second dose 1-2 months later (if age 9-14 years)
third dose 6 months after first dose (if age 9-14 years)
vaccines.indication: Prevents HPV infection (causes cervical cancer, genital warts).
vaccines.additional_information: HPV vaccination is most effective when started before sexual activity begins, offering protection against HPV-related cancers and diseases.

vaccines.name: Meningococcal
vaccines.composition: Purified polysaccharide of Neisseria meningitidis serogroups A, C, Y, and W-135 conjugated to diphtheria toxoid or protein.
vaccines.additional_information: Meningococcal vaccination is recommended for adolescents to protect against these potentially deadly bacterial infections.
